questions.question: Which of the following events would increase the quantity supplied of newsprint (newspapers)?

choices.answer: An increase in the price of newsprint
A decrease in the price of newsprint
A decrease in the number of firms manufacturing newsprint
A decrease in the price of wood pulp, used to make newsprint

questions.question: According to the law of supply, if the market price of water bottles increases, ceteris paribus

choices.answer: the demand for water bottles would decrease
the quantity supplied of water bottles would decrease
the supply of water bottles would decrease
the quantity supplied of water bottles would increase

questions.question: Which is most likely to result in a shift to the right in the demand curve for orange juice?

choices.answer: A bumper crop of oranges in Florida
A decrease in price of Tang (substitute for orange juice)
Expectations of higher future income among juice drinkers
Expectations of lower future prices for orange juice

questions.question: Frank's income increases & he purchases more ice cream and less popsicles. For Frank, popcicles

choices.answer: Are a joint product
Are a complementary good with ice cream
Are a normal good
Are an inferior good

questions.question: Which of the following is likely to have the most elastic demand?

choices.answer: A good with a vertical demand curve
All types of soda pop
Sprite
Life-sustaining pills

questions.question: Which results in a definite decrease in price, and an uncertain change in demand:

choices.answer: Demand shifting left, Supply staying the same
Demand shifting left, Supply shifting right
Demand staying the same, Supply shifting right
Demand shifting left, Supply shifting left

questions.question: A store raises prices 20% and total rev. rises 10%, its product demand in this price range is

choices.answer: Inelastic
Elastic
Perfectly elastic
Perfectly inelastic

questions.question: Which will occur if a legal price floor is placed on a good below its freemarket equilibrium?

choices.answer: Surpluses will develop.
Shortages will develop.
Underground markets will develop.
The equilibrium price will ration the good.

questions.question: If an excise tax is imposed on a product, how do consumer surplus and producer surplus change?

choices.answer: Both decrease
Consumer surplus decreases, producer surplus increases
Consumer surplus decreases, producer surplus stays the same
Consumer surplus stays the same, producer surplus increases

questions.question: If the government established a quota of 1000 in this market, the quota rent would be
